nodes.bodyText: I would make this name a bit more unique perhaps, like forge:unknown or something
braces { should be on new line for a forge class
Not sure if this should be patched in? Probably better in ForgeMod or something no?

That could be an alternative solution, but since we don't have a registry for ILootConditions, when would be the best way to initialize it?
Mod constructor? In a new event for loot tables specifically?

I figured that vanilla registers them statically on bootup (-.-).
I reworked the addition into an AT and I register the class statically when Forge is initialized. A nice side effect of this is that other mods can now register their own conditions without having to AT or reflect themselves.
Of course, if an alternative ends up being available, like an event, the static init can be dropped in favor of the event.

Not necessary, but more so as a failsafe. This way a malicious mod cannot alter the name of the loot table after it has been loaded, preventing weird and hard to track down issues with desyncs between what vanilla thinks and what loot modifiers perceive.
This method feels out of place here. It should either be at the top after the constants, or below right before the Builder.
I guess after rebasing, it left an unintended change in this file?
